title: Alliance to Feed the Earth in Disasters
keyQuestions: What is the probability of a (non-AI) catastrophe which makes ALLFED's work relevant (i.e., which kills 10% or more of humanity, but not all of humanity) over the next 50 to 100 years?
How much does the value of the future diminish in a catastrophe which makes ALLFED's work relevant?
How does the cause area feeding the Earth in disasters compare to other cause areas?
Is ALLFED making progress in its "feeding everyone no matter what" agenda?
Is ALLFED's progress on the lobbying front, or on the research front?
Is ALLFED producing high-quality research? On a Likert scale of 1-5, how strong are their papers and public writing?
Given that ALLFED has a large team, is it a positive influence on its team members? How would we expect employees and volunteers to rate their experience with the organization?
